metadata.title: CVE-2023-3159 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A use after free issue was discovered in driver/firewire inoutbound_phy_packet_callback in the Linux Kernel. In this flaw a localattacker with special privilege may cause a use after free problem whenqueue_event() fails.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-124.140~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-124.140~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
